TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ProjectRootElement extends Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElementContainer

Docs.summary: Represents an MSBuild project, a targets file, or any other file that conforms to MSBuild project file schema. This class and its related classes allow a complete MSBuild project or targets file to be read and written.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Comments and white space cannot be edited through this model at present. Each project root element is associated with exactly one project collection. This allows the owner of that project collection to control its lifetime and not be surprised by edits that come from another project collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectImportElement AddImport(string project) cil managed
Public Function AddImport (project As String) As ProjectImportElement

Docs.param: The project to be imported.
Docs.summary: Adds a project import to this project.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If import groups exist, inserts the project import into the last import group that has no Condition attribute; otherwise, creates an import at the end of the project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectImportGroupElement AddImportGroup() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an import group at the end of this project.
Docs.returns: The import group created at the end of this project.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This convenience method picks a location in the MSBuild DOM based on a heuristic.

Docs.summary: Adds an item to this project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectItemElement AddItem(string itemType, string include) cil managed
Public Function AddItem (itemType As String, include As String) As ProjectItemElement

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The item type of the item to be added.
The Include value of the item to be added.
Docs.summary: Adds an item to this project.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Creates an item, then adds it to an item group with no Condition attribute and at least one item of same item type. If no such item group is found, creates a new item group and adds the item to it. Items are ordered by Include values.
Does nothing if the item matches an existing wildcard expression for this item type.

Docs.param: The item type of the item to be added.
The Include value of the item to be added.
The metadata to be added.
Docs.summary: Adds an item with metadata to this project.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Creates an item, then adds it to an item group with no Condition attribute and at least one item of same item type. If no such item group is found, creates a new item group and adds the item to it. Items are ordered by Include values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectItemDefinitionElement AddItemDefinition(string itemType) cil managed
Public Function AddItemDefinition (itemType As String) As ProjectItemDefinitionElement

Docs.param: The item type of the item definition to be added.
Docs.summary: Adds an item definition to this project.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Creates an item, then adds it to an item group with no Condition attribute and at least one item of same item type. If no such item group is found, creates a new item group and adds the item to it. Items are ordered by Include values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectItemDefinitionGroupElement AddItemDefinitionGroup() cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds an item definition group to this project.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Creates and adds an item definition group after the last existing item definition group, if any. Otherwise, creates an item definition group after the last existing property group, if any. If no property group exists, creates a new item definition group at the end of the project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectItemGroupElement AddItemGroup() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and adds an item group to this project.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Creates and adds an item group after the last existing item group, if any. Otherwise, creates an item group after the last existing property group, if any. If no property group exists, creates a new item group at the end of the project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectPropertyElement AddProperty(string name, string value) cil managed
Public Function AddProperty (name As String, value As String) As ProjectPropertyElement

Docs.param: The name of the property to be updated or added.
The value of the property to be updated or added.
Docs.summary: Updates or adds a property to this project.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Updates the last existing property with the specified `name` that has no Condition attribute on itself or on the property group that contains it. Otherwise, creates a property and adds it to the first property group that has no Condition attribute. If no such property group exists, creates a property group after the last existing property group, if any, and adds the property to it . Otherwise, creates and adds a property group to the start of the project, and adds the property to it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectPropertyGroupElement AddPropertyGroup() cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds a new property group to this project.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Creates a property group and adds it after the last existing property group, if any. Otherwise, adds the property group to the start of the project.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Convenience method that picks a location based on a heuristic: Creates a target at the end of the project.

Docs.summary: Gets the directory path to the project file.

Docs.summary: Saves the project, if modified, to the file system.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Uses the character Encoding returned by the Encoding property. Marks the project as unmodified.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Save(class System.IO.TextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The text writer to write the project to.
Docs.summary: Saves the project to the specified text writer, whether modified or not.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Uses the character encoding of the TextWriter. Marks the project as unmodified.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Save(string path) cil managed

Docs.param: The file path to the project in storage.
Docs.summary: Saves the project, if modified or if the file path to storage has changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Marks the project as unmodified.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Save(class System.Text.Encoding saveEncoding) cil managed

Docs.param: The character encoding used to save the project.
Docs.summary: Saves the project, if modified, using the specified character encoding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Marks the project as unmodified.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Save (string path, System.Text.Encoding encoding);
.method public hidebysig instance void Save(string path, class System.Text.Encoding encoding) cil managed
public: void Save(System::String ^ path, System::Text::Encoding ^ encoding);

Docs.param: The file path to the project in storage.
The character encoding used to save the project.
Docs.summary: Saves the project, if modified or if the file path to storage has changed. Uses the specified character encoding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Marks the project as unmodified.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ToolsVersion { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ToolsVersion : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the ToolsVersion attribute.
Docs.value: The ToolsVersion attribute value, or an empty string if the ToolsVersion attribute is not present.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Removes the ToolsVersion attribute if the value to set is an empty string or null.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ToolsVersionLocation As ElementLocation

Docs.summary: Gets the location of the ToolsVersion attribute on this element, if any.
Docs.value: The location of the ToolsVersion attribute, or if there is no ToolsVersion attribute.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ TreatAsLocalProperty { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.TreatAsLocalProperty : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the TreatAsLocalProperty attribute.
Docs.value: The TreatAsLocalProperty attribute value, or an empty string if the TreatAsLocalProperty attribute is not present.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Removes the TreatAsLocalProperty attribute if the value to set is an empty string or null.
For more information about the `TreatAsLocalProperty` attribute, see [Project Element (MSBuild)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d1cda56a-dbef-4109-9201-39e962e3f653) and [How to: Build the Same Source Files with Different Options](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d14f1212-ddd9-434f-b138-f840011b0fb2).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TreatAsLocalPropertyLocation As ElementLocation

Docs.summary: Gets the location of the TreatAsLocalProperty attribute on this element, if any.
Docs.value: The TreatAsLocalProperty attribute location, or if there is no TreatAsLocalProperty attribute.

Docs.summary: Gets the project root in the global project collection that was loaded into memory from the specified file path. or if it is not currently in memory.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement TryOpen(string path) cil managed
Public Shared Function TryOpen (path As String) As ProjectRootElement

Docs.param: The path of the ProjectRootElement, cannot be .
Docs.summary: Gets the project root in the global project collection that was loaded into memory from the specified file path.
Docs.returns: The project root, or if no project was loaded into memory from the specified file path.

remarks.format: ## Remarks It is possible for ProjectRootElements to be brought into memory and discarded due to memory pressure. If TryOpen returns null it does not indicate that the project root has never been loaded, only that it is not currently in memory.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement TryOpen(string path, class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection projectCollection) cil managed

Docs.param: The path of the ProjectRootElement, cannot be .
The project collection to search for the project root.
Docs.summary: Gets the project root in the specified project collection that was loaded into memory from the specified file path.
Docs.returns: The project root, or if no project was loaded into memory from the specified file path.

remarks.format: ## Remarks It is possible for ProjectRootElements to be brought into memory and discarded due to memory pressure. If TryOpen returns `null` it does not indicate that the project root has never been loaded, only that it is not currently in memory.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property UsingTasks As ICollection(Of ProjectUsingTaskElement)

Docs.summary: Gets all child UsingTask Element (MSBuild) in this project.
Docs.value: All child UsingTask elements in this project.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Version As Integer
public: property int Version { int get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the version number of this object.
Docs.value: The version number of this object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Compare this version number to a stored version number to determine whether the project XML content has changed, even if the project is saved after the change. An edit may increment the version number more than once, so Version should only be compared to a stored value.
